title: Archon (dNetHack)
data:
In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), **Archons** are a group of related monsters, the most common type of lawful angel. The vanilla [Archon](/wiki/Archon "Archon") is known as a **Throne Archon** in dNetHack. As with most other angelic monsters, Archons will only be generated in the [Planes](/wiki/End_Game "End Game").

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Archon (Dungeons & Dragons)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Archon_\(Dungeons_%26_Dragons\) "wikipedia:Archon (Dungeons & Dragons)")***

**Iasoian Archons** use their star blades automatically, like [Coure Eladrin](/wiki/Coure_Eladrin "Coure Eladrin"), with a chance of attacking each adjacent monster every turn. They are skipped in their main attack sequence. Although they are not randomly generated, there is a statue of one on the [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer") quest. It will revive tame and loyal, but will have the plague and be unable to move until cured.

Iasoian Archons will lifesave any allied monsters (monsters of the same tame/peaceful/hostile status) on the level, as well as the player if tame. Lifesaving a monster increases mspec\_used by the lifesaved monster's max HP. Lifesaving the player will cancel the Iasoian Archon.

| A Panakeian Archon:* can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly").
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* [regenerates HP quickly](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration").
* can [see invisible creatures](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible").
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [lord to its kind](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD").
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* resists death magic.
* resists [level drain](/wiki/Level_drain "Level drain"). |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |

**Panakeian Archons** cast recover, mass cure far, paralyze, mass cure close, sleep, destroy armor, destroy weapon, make web, and cure self. Although they are not randomly generated, there is a statue of one on the [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer") quest. It will revive tame and loyal, but will have the plague and be unable to move until cured.

html:
Archon (dNetHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In dNetHack, Archons are a group of related monsters, the most common type of lawful angel. The vanilla Archon is known as a Throne Archon in dNetHack. As with most other angelic monsters, Archons will only be generated in the Planes.

Wikipedia has an article about:
Archon (Dungeons & Dragons)

Justice Archon

7 Justice Archon (No tile)
Difficulty 9
Attacks Weapon 1d7 physical, Weapon 1d7 physical
7 Justice Archon (No tile)
Difficulty 9
Attacks

Weapon 1d7 physical, Weapon 1d7 physical

Base level 7
Base experience 102
Speed 7
Base AC 7
Base MR 77
Alignment 7 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size medium
Resistances fire, cold, sleep, shock, poison, level drain
Resistances conveyed None

A Justice Archon:

  • can fly.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • regenerates HP quickly.
  • can see invisible creatures.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is female.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • resists level drain.

Iasoian Archon

An Iasoian Archon:

  • can fly.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • regenerates HP quickly.
  • can see invisible creatures.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • resists death magic.
  • resists level drain.

Iasoian Archons use their star blades automatically, like Coure Eladrin, with a chance of attacking each adjacent monster every turn. They are skipped in their main attack sequence. Although they are not randomly generated, there is a statue of one on the Healer quest. It will revive tame and loyal, but will have the plague and be unable to move until cured.

Iasoian Archons will lifesave any allied monsters (monsters of the same tame/peaceful/hostile status) on the level, as well as the player if tame. Lifesaving a monster increases mspec_used by the lifesaved monster's max HP. Lifesaving the player will cancel the Iasoian Archon.

'''Iasoian Archons''' use their star blades automatically, like [[Coure Eladrin]], with a chance of attacking each adjacent monster every turn. They are skipped in their main attack sequence. Although they are not randomly generated, there is a statue of one on the [[Healer]] quest. It will revive tame and loyal, but will have the plague and be unable to move until cured.

Iasoian Archons will lifesave any allied monsters (monsters of the same tame/peaceful/hostile status) on the level, as well as the player if tame. Lifesaving a monster increases mspec_used by the lifesaved monster's max HP. Lifesaving the player will cancel the Iasoian Archon.
